input_text:
Job Title: Structural Design Engineer

Location: Rohnert Park, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Title: Structural Design EngineerPosition Type: Full TimeCompany: MKM & Associates Structural EngineeringLocation: Rohnert Park, CAPosting Date: April 5, 2024Pay Range: The annual base pay range for this role is $75,000 - $110,000.
Please email cover letter, resume and salary requirement to info@mkmassociates.com. Use “Structural Design Engineer” in the subject line. No phone calls please.
OverviewMKM & Associates is a structural engineering firm located in the heart of wine country. With 40+ years of work experience encompassing civic, commercial, educational, healthcare, historic, hospitality, residential, and winery/brewery markets we offer full-service design, drafting, and collaboration with sub-consultants to ensure that our clients receive the highest level of service. Visit our website at www.mkmassociates.com
PositionWe are currently looking for an experienced Structural Design Engineer. This position will give you the opportunity to work under licensed Structural Engineers with growth potential available.
General Job Duties (including but not limited to):Develop and design structural systems for buildings, bridges, and other structures using computer-aided design (CAD) software.Analyze blueprints, plans, and specifications to determine the requirements for structural design, including the size and strength of materials, building codes, and safety regulations.Conduct structural calculations to determine the loads, stresses, and forces that will be placed on the structure, and design solutions that will ensure the safety and stability of the building.Create detailed construction documents, including drawings and specifications, that provide contractors with the information they need to construct the structure.Work with other design team members, including architects and mechanical engineers, to ensure that the structural design is integrated with other building systems.Evaluate existing structures to determine if they are safe for continued use and develop plans to repair or retrofit structures as necessary.Attend site visits and meetings with clients and contractors to discuss design plans and construction progress.Use specialized software to simulate the behavior of structures under different conditions and make design modifications as necessary.Collaborate with project managers to develop project timelines and budgets and ensure that projects are completed on time and within budget.Keep up to date with new developments in structural design and construction methods and incorporate new techniques and technologies into designs as appropriate.
Physical Demands The position may require the employee to perform the following physical activities:﻿Sitting or standing for extended periods.Using a computer for extended periods.Lifting and carrying up to 25 pounds.Using manual dexterity to operate office equipment and handle paperwork.
Job QualificationsIt is preferred for applicants to have at least three years’ experience (5+ years is strongly preferred) in Structural Design of residential & commercial low-rise buildings working with timber, concrete, steel, and masonry construction materials.Excellent verbal, written communication, and computer skills a plus.Experience with engineering programs such as ETABS & ADAPT as well as AutoCAD is desirable.
Benefits401(k)Dental InsuranceFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountPaid time offVision insurance
This position is 100% onsite at our company office in Rohnert Park, CA. 5 days/week, 8-hour shifts. MKM values diversity and is dedicated to creating a workplace environment that provides individuals with a sense of belonging. We are committed to having a diverse workforce that is representative of the communities we serve. MKM is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer where all aspects of employment are based on merit, competence, performance, and business need. This job description is not intended to be a comprehensive list of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required for the job. MKM reserves the right to modify or amend the job description at any time.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: MKM values diversity and is dedicated to creating a workplace environment that provides individuals with a sense of belonging. They are committed to having a diverse workforce and are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

At least 3 years' experience in Structural Design of residential & commercial low-rise buildings, working with timber, concrete, steel, and masonry construction materials.
